intro: Scurrula korthalsii, commonly known as the Cape mountain thistle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Scurrula korthalsii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
